page.title: 19THE GOVERNMENT OF HINXWORTH
page.content: Although we at the moment do have a local councillor living in the village the only way we really have any say in the way the affairs of the village are run is through the Parish Council.This consists of 6 villagers chaired by Mr Harry King. It has an income of Â£1350 from the rates which is spent in vari- ous ways. In 1984 it was used to buy the 3/4 acre plot of the old sewage farm from the District council after mains drainage had been installed.That was then planted as a small wood. The Parish council oversees the upkeep of the footpaths etc and is active in seeing that present agricultural prac- tices of spraying, removing of hedge- rows and straw burning are changed.The war memorial is also being repaired, painted and new seats fitted.Unfortun- ately it is currently disputing owner- ship of a plot of land in its care.
